arm_group.description: This study is planned to determine the kallikrein panel of 200 patients presenting with biochemical recurrence (PSA>0.05ng/ml) after radical prostatectomy prior to any additional therapy.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate if a new blood test looking at PSA and a group
      of PSA related proteins in a patient's blood can indicate which men after surgery with a
      rising PSA could benefit from treatment, and/or indicate which men are at higher risk for
      recurrence before initial treatment is given.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Molecular Forms of PSA and Human Kallikrein 2 in a Cohort of Patients With Locally Resected Prostate Cancer But Biochemical Recurrence

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients treated with radical prostatectomy that develop a rising serum PSA
             >0.05ng/ml and have not received any kind of additional therapy.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Previous additional therapy for prostate cancer

          -  No evidence of rising PSA

          -  Patients unwilling to undergo venesection

study_pop.textblock:
Potential research subjects will be identified by a member of the patient's treatment, the
        protocol investigator, or research team at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center (MSKCC).

intervention.description: Venous blood will be collected in a 7ml EDTA Vacutainer tube and will be immediately put on ice. Samples will be centrifuged at 1900g (3000-3200 RPM) for 15 Minutes and the serum aliquoted into freezer vials and stored at -80°C until analysis.

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Molecular Forms of PSA and Human Kallikrein 2 in a Cohort of Patients With Locally Resected Prostate Cancer But Biochemical Recurrence

primary_outcome.description: of patients that present with biochemical recurrence after radical prostatectomy.
primary_outcome.measure: profile of a panel of kallikrein related serine proteases in the blood

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
